intro: Pimpinella major var. macrodonta, commonly known as the large-flowered cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and pinnately compound leaves with serrated margins. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, with a distinctive hooded structure on the petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
